item.title: RT by @Delafina777: We're not being hostile by telling you that what you claim to know about us is completely wrong. We don't say Christian prayers, and Jesus is completely irrelevant to our religion.

item.description: We're not being hostile by telling you that what you claim to know about us is completely wrong. We don't say Christian prayers, and Jesus is completely irrelevant to our religion.

item.title: RT by @Delafina777: Requiring people to engage in religious rituals they don't want to engage in is a violation of our right to freedom of religion, whether everyone gets to to take turns in the driver's seat or not.

item.description: Requiring people to engage in religious rituals they don't want to engage in is a violation of our right to freedom of religion, whether everyone gets to to take turns in the driver's seat or not.

item.title:
That's the thing that is so frustrating to have to explain to non-Jews over and over and over again.
Yes, *in English*, goy is often used in a negative way to refer to gentiles.
In Hebrew, it literally means "nation." It's used for Jews too.
item.dc:creator: @Delafina777
item.description:

item.title: RT by @Delafina777: In one of your follow-up posts, Michael, you complain that Weeping Woman is "uglier" than Picasso's student work on the left. It's a painting that tries to make you feel what a woman feels when her child is killed by fascists. It should be ugly.
item.dc:creator: @shaenongarrity
item.description: In one of your follow-up posts, Michael, you complain that Weeping Woman is "uglier" than Picasso's student work on the left. It's a painting that tries to make you feel what a woman feels when her child is killed by fascists. It should be ugly.

item.title: RT by @Delafina777: A great question! The painting on the right is "Weeping Woman," one of a series of paintings Picasso produced in response to the bombing of the city of Guernica by fascist dictator Francisco Franco.
item.dc:creator: @shaenongarrity
item.description:
A great question! The painting on the right is "Weeping Woman," one of a series of paintings Picasso produced in response to the bombing of the city of Guernica by fascist dictator Francisco Franco.
